file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-45-01-04 - ENGINE LOW-PRESSURE SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ENGINE LOW-PRESSURE SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the engine low-pressure switch. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ENGINE LOW-PRESSURE SWITCH - RE- ALL 28-45-01-000-801-A MOVAL ENGINE LOW-PRESSURE SWITCH - IN- ALL 28-45-01-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-45-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-45-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ENGINE LOW-PRESSURE SWITCH - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task is applicable to the LH and RH engines. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - OPENING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 LH engine 423 RH engine D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To remove the Engine Low-Pressure Switch, GSE 200 Wrench, Fuel Nozzle or Commercially Open End Crowfoot Wrench, 3/8 Drive Alternative to GSE 200 available 3/4", "Snap-On" PN FC024A Commercially Extension 6 inch, 3/8", "Snap-On" PN To remove the Engine Low-Pressure Switch available FXK6 or similar Commercially Breaker Bar Wrench, 3/8, "Snap-On" To the remove Engine Low-Pressure Switch available PN F12LA or similar E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-45-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. (2) Put the workstand in the work area. (3) Open the lower cowling ( AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400) to get access to the engine. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connector (1) from the engine low-pressure switch. (2) Use GSE 200 or drive crowfoot wrench (4) with Extension (5) and breaker bar to remove the engine low-pressure switch (2) and the O-ring (3). (3) Discard the O-ring (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-45-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Engine Low-Pressure Switch - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 415 C B DET. A DET. B 4. DRIVE CROWFOOT FITTING WRENCH (REF.) 5. EXTENSION 6. TORQUE WRENCH 3. O-RING 1. ELECTRICAL 1 CONNECTOR DET. C 2. ENGINE LOW PRESSURE SW 1 EM145AMM280079C.DGN TORQUE: 5.6 - 7.3 N.m (50 - 65 lb.in) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-45-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-45-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ENGINE LOW-PRESSURE SWITCH - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task is applicable to the LH and RH engines. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION 28-21-00 - AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - CLOSING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 LH engine 423 RH engine D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To install the Engine Low-Pressure Switch, GSE 200 Wrench, Fuel Nozzle or Commercially Open End Crowfoot Wrench, 3/8 Drive Alternative to GSE 200 available 3/4", "Snap-On" PN FC024A Commercially Extension 6 inch, 3/8", "Snap-On" PN To install the Engine Low-Pressure Switch available FXK6 Commercially Adjustable Click Type Torque Wrench, To apply torque to the Engine Low-Pressure available 3/8, "snap-On" PN QD2R200 or similar Switch E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring 28-21-00 1 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-45-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, make sure that the circuit breakers below are open and with a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag attached to them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Install the O-ring (3) on the engine low-pressure switch (2). (2) Use GSE 200 or drive crowfoot wrench (4) with extension (5) and breaker bar to install the engine low-pressure switch (2) on the fitting. (3) With torque wrench (6) apply to torque to the low-pressure switch (2) on the fitting. (4) Connect the electrical connector (1). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the lower cowling ( AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Remove the workstand. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-45-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
